pitt.search.semanticvectors.vectors
Class Vector

java.lang.Object
  pitt.search.semanticvectors.vectors.Vector
Direct Known Subclasses:
BinaryVector, ComplexVector, RealVector
public abstract class Vector
extends java.lang.Object

Base representation of a vector over a particular ground field and vector operations. Designed to enable real, complex, and binary implementations.

Author:
Dominic Widdows

Method Detail

copy

public abstract Vector copy()
Returns a copy of this vector.

generateRandomVector

protected abstract Vector generateRandomVector(int dimension,
                                               int numEntries,
                                               java.util.Random random)
Creates a sparse vector with appropriate entries from the random seed. Ideally this would be a static method of the implementing class, but it's not easy to express this with either an abstract class or an interface. Client implementations should use the VectorFactory class, hence the protected status.

Parameters:
dimension - number of dimension of vector returned
numEntries - number of non-zero entries, usually a combination of +/-1 entries as determined by implementation
random - random seed for generation

getDimension

public abstract int getDimension()
Returns the dimension of the vector.

isZeroVector

public abstract boolean isZeroVector()
Returns true if this is a representation of a zero vector.

measureOverlap

public abstract double measureOverlap(Vector other)
Returns a canonical overlap measure (usually between 0 and 1) between this and other.

superpose

public abstract void superpose(Vector other,
                               double weight,
                               int[] permutation)
Superposes other vector onto this one with given weight, usually by vector addition. Coordinates of other vector may be permuted and reweighted in the process. Permuted coordinates supports encoding of order information, as begun by Sahlgren, Holst and Kanerva 2008.

Parameters:
other - vector to be added
weight - multiple of other vector added (TODO widdows support complex weights)
permutation - represents the permutation to be applied while adding, so that the ith coordinate of other is added to the coordinate given by the ith entry in this list. Can be NULL in which case no permutation is applied.

bind

public abstract void bind(Vector other,
                          int direction)
Binds the other vector into this one. Does not necessarily guarantee that this.bind(other, 1) is equal to other.bind(this, -1).

Parameters:
direction - if direction > 0, binding is on the right, otherwise it is on the left

release

public abstract void release(Vector other,
                             int direction)
Releases the other vector from this one.

Parameters:
direction - if direction > 0, binding is on the right, otherwise it is on the left

bind

public abstract void bind(Vector other)
Binds the other vector to this one.

release

public abstract void release(Vector other)
Inverse of the binding operator

normalize

public abstract void normalize()
Transforms vector to a normalized representation. A normalized representation should satisfy the property that measureOverlap with itself is equal to 1.0, to within precision tolerances.

writeToLuceneStream

public abstract void writeToLuceneStream(org.apache.lucene.store.IndexOutput outputStream)
Writes vector to Lucene output stream. Writes exactly getDimension() coordinates.

readFromLuceneStream

public abstract void readFromLuceneStream(org.apache.lucene.store.IndexInput inputStream)
Reads vector from Lucene input stream. Reads exactly getDimension() coordinates.

writeToString

public abstract java.lang.String writeToString()
Writes vector to text representation. Writes exactly getDimension() coordinates.

readFromString

Reads vector from text representation. Reads exactly getDimension() coordinates.
